TheUndergroundRailroad: I thought I had a bit of an understanding, but there is no way, not even now
This book is so well crafted
A real and human glimpse into the horrors of slavery, and the actual history of America, is a sad gift indeed, but a gift we must open and look upon if we are to become human ourselves
This fictionalised account utilizes metaphor and analogy in such a way that relates and magnifies, as it illustrates this heartbreaking era for our minds and our hearts
Criticisms of the book do not take into account that it is a (historical) fictional, metaphorical account
